about_the_game:
Repair and Defend is a captivating blend of tile-placement and tower defense mechanics where you strategically place randomly drawn tiles to repair faulty packages and repair them before they reach the shipping department. Each tile you place is crucial in maintaining the efficiency of your conveyor belts while defending against the constant flow of defective products.

Tile-Placement meets Tower Defense: Repair and Defend combines the strategic depth of tile-placement with the urgency of tower defense, creating a fresh and engaging puzzle experience.

Roguelike Structure: Every playthrough is different, featuring randomly generated tiles, challenges, rewards, and events. Progressing through the game unlocks more elements, ensuring endless replayability and new strategic possibilities.

Modes & Modifiers: A variety of game modes, factory layouts, modifiers, and challenges make each session unique, encouraging players to continually refine their strategies.

Gameplay:

Each round, you place randomly drawn tiles on the factory floor. You can spend credits to skip a tile. Once you're ready, initiate the next wave of packages and watch your defenses in action.

Repair stations fix faulty packages before they reach the shipping department. Conveyor belts guide the packages through the factory. Floor Space Extensions give you more space to build. Utility tiles offer credits or other bonuses. Strategically placed boosters enhance the efficiency of adjacent repair equipment, and more.

Features:

2 Game Modes: Campaign, Daily Defense(?)
3 Factory Layouts: Each with its own playstyle
50+ Tiles: Including repair stations, conveyor belts, and utility items
50+ Bonus Cards: Offering various upgrades and buffs
10+ Events: That can either help or challenge your progress
10+ Game Modifiers
10 Achievements

About the Developer:

Repair and Defend is developed by Simran Anand, a solo game developer with a passion for crafting unique gaming experiences. Simran's previous work includes Sea of Change, a positively reviewed indie title that further established their reputation in the indie game development community.
